content.content: 目的を達する手段
a means to an end
金は目的を達する手段に過ぎぬ
Money is only a means to an end.
金そのものを愛するは手段と目的を誤るのである
Those who love money for itself mistake the means for the end.
目的は善いが手段が悪い
The end is good, but the means is bad.
目的は手段を神聖にす(嘘も方便)
“The end sanctifies the means”―“The end justifies the means.”
彼は目的を達するに手段を選ばぬ
He is unscrupulous about the means of gaining his end.
手段を選ばず目的を遂げる
He will accomplish his purpose by fair means or fool―by hook or by crook.
こんな非常の場合には手段を選んでおられん
We can not afford to be scrupulous about the means―nice about the means―under such desperate circumstances.
戦争と恋事には手段を選ばず
“All is fair in love and war.”
手段を用いる、手段を取る
to resort to some means―take measures―take steps
断然たる手段を取らねばならぬ
We must take decisive measures―“take the bull by the horns.”
勧めて聴かなけれや手段を変えなけりゃならぬ
If he will not yield to persuasion, we must resort to some other means.
ありとあらゆる手段を尽した
I have tried every means in my power―left no means untried―left no stones unturned.
ほかに取るべき手段は無い
There is no other means―no other resource―no alternative.
逃げるよりほかに手段は無い
I have no resource but to fly―Flight is my only resource―There is nothing for it but to run―I must run for it.
手段が尽きた
I am at the end of my resources―I am at my wits' end―I am put to my shifts―I am put to my trumps.

content:
2. 
〈形容詞付〉

content.content: 最後の手段
the last resort―the last resource―the final appeal―extreme measures―extremes―extremities
腕力に訴えるのは最後の手段だ
Force is the last resort.
戦争は最後の手段である
War is the last resource―the final appeal.
最後の手段として訴えた
I went to law as a last resort―in the last resort.
最後の手段を取る
to take extreme measures―proceed to extremities―go to extremes
最後の手段を取る気は無い
I have no mind to go to extremes.
悪辣手段
villainy―rascally proceedings―sharp practice―unscrupulous means
あれは悪辣手段で起こした身代だ
He has made his fortune by unscrupulous means―by sharp practice.
あれは悪辣手段を用いる人だ
He is an unscrupulous man.
卑劣手段を用いる
to resort to base artifices―low tricks―dirty tricks―shabby tricks―dog's tricks―artful dodges
彼は卑劣手段で僕をだましおった
He has played a dirty trick on me―played it low down on me.
報復手段
a retaliatory measure
強硬手段を用いる
to resort to forcible means―force―compulsion
強硬手段を用いなければできぬ
It can not be done without resort to compulsion―It must be done by force.
徳義上の手段でいかなければ強硬手段を用いるよりほかは無い
If it can not be done by moral suasion, it must be done by force.
彼の信任を得るには正直にするのが唯一の手段だ
Honesty is the only means to gain his confidence―the only passport to his confidence.
これは間違いの無い手段だ
This is a sure means―a sure card.
あれは我々に油断をさせる手段だ
That is a ruse to throw us off our guard.
あれは我々の目をくらます手段だ
That is a trick to throw dust in our eyes―a ruse to blind us―a blind.

content:
しゅちょう〔主張〕
〈名〉Assertion; insistence; persistence; maintenance; advocacy; vindication; contention; protestation; declaration; pretension; claim:(主張の論)one's position:(主張の意見)one's point:(=する) to assert (a fact); to maintain (an opinion); to advocate (a policy); to protest (one's innocence); to vindicate (one's rights); to contend, claim, hold (that it is so); will have it (that it is so); to stand to (one's assertion); to stand on (trifles); to stand for (a course); to take one's stand on (one's principles); to declare (for or against a policy):(ぜひと主張する)to insist on (doing something); must positively (do something):(どこまでも主張する)to persist in (one's denial):(しきりに主張する)to lay stress on, emphasize (a fact):(所有権を主張する)to claim, lay claim to, pretend to (the property)

content.content: 彼はその説は本当だと堅く主張している
He strongly asserts that the statement is true―asserts the statement to be true―asserts the truth of the statement.
権利を主張する
to assert one's rights―vindicate one's rights―insist on one's rights―stand on one's rights
この寒いのに君は執拗に権利を主張するじゃないか
You are tenacious of your rights this cold day.
身の潔白を主張する
to assert one's innocence―protest one's innocence
こんな歴然たる証拠の挙がったにもかかわらず彼はもだ無罪を主張している
He asserts his innocence―asserts himself to be innocent―in the face of these glaring facts.
僕は彼の無罪であることを主張する
I will stand to it that he is innocent.
意見を主張する
to maintain an opinion
彼は酒精は滋養になると言って主張している
He maintains―contends―claims―holds―will have it―that alcohol is a food.
自説を主張する
to stand to one's assertion
僕は是が非でも自説を主張するわけではない
I do not persist in error―I am open to conviction.
民権を主張する
to assert popular rights―defend the liberties of the people
改革を主張する
to advocate reform
彼は熱心な改革の主張者である
He is a zealous advocate of reform.
彼もまた遼東還付を主張している
He also advocates the restoration of the Liaotung Peninsula to China.
彼はぜひそのわけを聞かねばならぬと主張した
He insisted upon knowing the reason―He must positively know the reason.
僕は時間の経済を主張するものである
I insist upon economy of time.
彼はしきりに系統の必要を主張している
He strenuously insists upon the importance of system.
君がぜひと主張せらるるなら僕は何とも言わぬ
If you insist upon it,―If you will have it so,―I have nothing to say against it.
彼はどこまでも知らぬ存ぜぬと主張している
He persists in denying his knowledge.
僕はどこまでも主義を主張する
I take my stand on my principles.
彼は些細なことを主張する
He will stand on trifles―He is a stickler for trifles.
彼は文法主張家だ
He is a stickler for grammar.
財産相続権を主張する
to claim the property―lay claim to the property
相続権主張者
a claimant to the property
継位権を主張する
to pretend to the throne
継位権主張者が二人ある
There are two pretenders to the throne.
主張者
an advocate―a claimant―a pretender
主戦論を主張するものあり非戦論を主張するものあり
Some declare for war, others declare against war.
彼はその時酩酊しておったということをしきりに主張している
He lays stress on the fact that he was drunk on the occasion.
彼は死んでしまうと言って主張している
He insists on dying―He is for dying.
反対派の主張はどういうのか
What is the position of the opposite party?
あの新聞は主義も主張も無い
The paper has no principle or position.
主張を通す、主張を貫く
to carry one's point
主張をまげる
to concede a point―make a compromise

じゅつ〔術〕
〈名〉
1. (=技術)an art

content.content: 飛行術

content: 2. (=手段)means

content.content: のがれる術無し

彼を救うの術無し
